overview:
Grant Martin is a co-founder of Farehelper, Editor in Chief of Gadling and established research scientist at Applied Thin Films in Evanston, IL.

With a bachelor’s degree in Materials Science and Engineering from The University of Michigan, Mr. Martin has been working in the web sector since 2007, where he oversaw the rise of Gadling from a mainstream travel blog to a leading provider of content for the Huffington Post Media Group. In his current role within that group, he manages a group of nearly two dozen freelance contributors for Gadling while dictating the voice and creative direction of the site.

Mr. Martin’s role at Farehelper grew from his intimate familiarity with the online travel booking experience. Realizing a gap in the current marketplace for creative, empowered searching, he co-founded Farehelper in 2010 to address the needs of savvy travelers. He now contributes to the marketing and strategy efforts of that enterprise from Chicago, IL.
